name: SSO, TIVIAN Access, Okta, MFA
title: SSO, TIVIAN Access, Okta, MFA
body:
Original Confluence URL: https://qbdocs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/1LS/pages/1599930386/SSO%2C+TIVIAN+Access%2C+Okta%2C+MFA - please cross-check the quality of the ZD article with the Confluence counterpart and remove this line before publishing the ZD article

Overview

This article provides information about Single Sign-On (SSO), TIVIAN Access, Okta, and Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA). It includes instructions for resetting MFA for users with new devices and links to additional resources.

 

Information

This guide focuses on managing user access and authentication through Okta, specifically addressing MFA reset procedures and providing links to related documentation.

 

  • Okta Dashboard Access
  • Resetting MFA for Users with New Devices
  • Additional Resources

 

Okta Dashboard Access

To access the Okta Dashboard, use the following link: https://questback-admin.okta.com/admin/dashboard

 

Resetting MFA for Users with New Devices

When a user has a new device and needs to re-enroll for Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), follow these steps:

Step 1

Navigate to Directory > People in the Okta Dashboard.

Step 2

Search for the user's name or email address.

Step 3

Select the user from the search results.

Step 4

Click on "More Actions" in the user's profile.

Step 5

Choose "Reset Multifactor" from the dropdown menu.

 

Additional Resources

For more information on Okta setup and TIVIAN Access, refer to the following resources:

  • Global Okta Setup
  • Tivian Access: IAM with Okta

 

FAQ

What is MFA?

MFA stands for Multi-Factor Authentication. It is a security measure that requires users to provide two or more verification factors to gain access to an account or system.

Why do I need to reset MFA for a user with a new device?

When a user gets a new device, they need to re-enroll in MFA to ensure that the new device is properly authenticated and can receive MFA prompts or codes.

 

Tags: SSO, TIVIAN Access, Okta, MFA, Multi-Factor Authentication, User Management
